title: Permits division of human rights to recommend prosecution of bias-related violence incidents
summary: Provides that the commissioner of the division of human rights shall have power to investigate incidents apparently motivated by racial or other bias and, where appropriate, to recommend prosecution to the attorney general or to the appropriate district attorney.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2526

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 19, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. JEFFRIES -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Governmental Operations

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  executive law, in relation to recommendation to
         prosecute incidents of bias-related violence

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.    Section 295 of the executive law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 11-a to read as follows:
    3    11-A. TO INVESTIGATE EACH REPORTED  INCIDENT  OF  VIOLENCE  WHICH  WAS
    4  APPARENTLY  MOTIVATED BY RACIAL OR OTHER BIAS AND, WHERE APPROPRIATE, TO
    5  RECOMMEND PROSECUTION TO THE ATTORNEY GENERAL OR TO THE DISTRICT  ATTOR-
    6  NEY OF THE COUNTY IN WHICH SUCH INCIDENT OCCURRED.
    7    S 2.  This act shall take effect immediately.







        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05027-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to recommendation to prosecute incidents of bias-related violence
